alert.note: Alert for Grant; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF GRANT, EASTERN OWEN AND SOUTHWESTERN PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 407 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Owenton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Dry Ridge, Owenton, Morgan, Corinth, Stewartsville, Elk Lake, Cherry Grove, Long Ridge, Natlee, Marcus, Twin Bridges, Keefer, Camp Northward, Needmore, New Columbus, Holbrook, Lawrenceville, Cordova and Elliston. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
